intro: Fimbristylis fuscinux, commonly known as the yellow false spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family (Poaceae). It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines, and thrives in wetland and swampy environments. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a basal growth habit. Fimbristylis fuscinux is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in aquatic habitats.
